sentences.english: The junta has threatened to use force, and the NMSP no longer trusts the generals.
sentences.chinese: 军政府威胁要使用武力，新孟邦党不再信任将军们。

sentences.english: We must work hard to raise to a new level the military and political quality of our army.
sentences.chinese: 要奋发图强，把我军的军政素质提高到一个新的水平。

sentences.english: Instead, it will make it even cagier in handling the offers of aid.
sentences.chinese: 相反，它会令军政府更加谨慎地对待援助问题。

sentences.english: The Hunan faction is an important military and political force in the late Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 湘系势力是晚清时期的一派重要军政力量。

sentences.english: The people is held down by a vicious and repressive military regime.
sentences.chinese: 人民受着凶恶而专制的军政权的压迫。

sentences.english: The military and civil authorities are working together to put down the unrest.
sentences.chinese: 军政和民政当局正联手镇压动乱。

sentences.english: During the past month, the junta has tighten security in the town and reenforced troops.
sentences.chinese: 在过去一个月里，军政府已加强安全和增强军队。

sentences.english: The west chamber was the place where the emperor read report, signed documents and discussed military and political affairs with his officials.
sentences.chinese: 西殿是皇帝批阅公文及与官员们商议军政大事的地方。

sentences.english: Without Suu Kyi, nobody is going to believe the junta.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有苏姬，没有人会相信军政府。

sentences.english: The junta fell less than a year later.
sentences.chinese: 不到一年后，军政府即告倒台。

sentences.english: The junta will leave no stones unturned to win the elections.
sentences.chinese: 军政府将不留余地务必努力赢得选举。

sentences.english: The military government repressed the striking workers.
sentences.chinese: 军政府镇压了罢工的工人。

sentences.english: And in so doing, they have put fear into the hearts of the leaders of the Burmese junta.
sentences.chinese: 这给缅甸军政权带来了内心的恐惧。

sentences.english: Even NLD efforts were severely curtailed by the junta.
sentences.chinese: 即使全民盟也受到了军政府的严重削弱。

sentences.english: Socio-economic damage from over 60 years of military rule is difficult to undo.
sentences.chinese: 军政权60年来所造成的社会经济破坏是很难弥补的。

sentences.english: Ye Myint is the regime's chief negotiator in talks with the ceasefire groups.
sentences.chinese: 叶敏是军政府与停火谈判的首席代表。

definition: to govern/to have complete control over/to be in command of
national politics/archaic rank, "Minister of State"/common given name
(orig.) tents forming the offices of a commanding officer/administration of a military government/(medieval Japan) "bakufu", administration of the shogun
to assume full responsibility/to be in full control/to monopolize
(army) commander-in-chief (archaic)/provincial military governor and civil administrator during the early Republic of China era (1911-1949 AD)
